intro: Pedicularis microphylla, commonly known as the lesser fairy-lance, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Pedicularis microphylla is often found in rocky or grassy areas, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
